Package net.royalur

Interface Game<P extends Piece,S extends PlayerState,R extends Roll>

Type Parameters:
P - The type of pieces that are stored on the board.
S - The type of state that is stored for each player.
R - The type of rolls that may be made.
All Known Implementing Classes:
StandardGame
public interface Game<P extends Piece,S extends PlayerState,R extends Roll>
A game of the Royal Game of Ur. Provides methods to allow the playing of games, and methods to support the retrieval of history about the moves that were made.

    • putMetadata

      void putMetadata(@Nonnull String key, @Nonnull String value)
      Sets the value of the metadata associated with the key key to value.
      Parameters:
      key - The key of the metadata item to be updated.
      value - The new value to be associated with the given metadata key.

    • removeMetadata

      void removeMetadata(@Nonnull String key)
      Removes any metadata associated with the key key.
      Parameters:
      key - The key of the metadata item to be removed.

    • getMetadata

      @Nonnull String getMetadata(@Nonnull String key)
      Retrieves the metadata associated with the key key.
      Parameters:
      key - The key of the metadata item to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      The metadata associated with the key key.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - If there is no metadata associated with the key key.

    • getMetadata

      @Nonnull Map<String,String> getMetadata()
      Retrieves all metadata about this game.
      Returns:
      The metadata about this game.

    • getStates

      @Nonnull List<GameState<P,S,R>> getStates()
      Retrieves the states that have occurred so far in the game. The last state in the list is the current state of the game.
      Returns:
      The states that have occurred so far in the game.

    • getCurrentState

      @Nonnull GameState<P,S,R> getCurrentState()
      Retrieve the state that the game is currently in.
      Returns:
      The state that the game is currently in.

    • rollDice

      void rollDice(@Nonnull R roll)
      Rolls the dice, with a known value of roll, and updates the state of the game accordingly.
      Parameters:
      roll - The value of the dice that is to be rolled.

    • rollDice

      @Nonnull R rollDice()
      Rolls the dice, and updates the state of the game accordingly.
      Returns:
      The value of the dice that were rolled.

    • rollDice

      @Nonnull R rollDice(int value)
      Rolls the dice with a known value of value, and updates the state of the game accordingly.
      Parameters:
      value - The value of the dice to be rolled.
      Returns:
      The value of the dice that were rolled.

    • findAvailableMoves

      @Nonnull List<Move<P>> findAvailableMoves()
      Finds all available moves that can be made from the current state of the game.
      Returns:
      All available moves that can be made from the current state of the game.

    • makeMove

      void makeMove(@Nonnull Move<P> move)
      Applies the move move to update the state of the game. This does not check whether the move is valid.
      Parameters:
      move - The move to make from the current state of the game.

    • makeMove

      void makeMove(@Nonnull P piece)
      Moves the piece piece, and updates the state of the game.
      Parameters:
      piece - The piece to be moved.

    • makeMoveIntroducingPiece

      void makeMoveIntroducingPiece()
      Moves a new piece onto the board.

    • makeMove

      void makeMove(@Nonnull Tile tile)
      Moves the piece on tile tile, and updates the state of the game.
      Parameters:
      tile - The tile where the piece to be moved resides.

    • getActionStates

      @Nonnull default List<ActionGameState<P,S,R>> getActionStates()
      Retrieves the states that represent the actions that have been made so far in the game. The last state in the list represents the last action that was taken in this game.
      Returns:
      The states that represent the actions that have been made so far in the game.

    • getLandmarkStates

      @Nonnull default List<GameState<P,S,R>> getLandmarkStates()
      Retrieves the states that represent the actions that have been made so far in the game. The last state in the list represents the last action that was taken in this game.
      Returns:
      The states that represent the actions that have been made so far in the game.

    • getCurrentStateType

      @Nonnull default GameStateType getCurrentStateType()
      Retrieve the type of state that the game is currently in.
      Returns:
      The type of state that the game is currently in.

    • isFinished

      default boolean isFinished()
      Determines whether the game is currently in a finished state.
      Returns:
      Whether the game is currently in a finished state.

    • isPlayable

      default boolean isPlayable()
      Determines whether the game is currently in a playable state.
      Returns:
      Whether the game is currently in a playable state.

    • getCurrentPlayableState

      @Nonnull default PlayableGameState<P,S,R> getCurrentPlayableState()
      Retrieves the current state of this game as an instance PlayableGameState. This will throw an error if the game is not in a playable state.
      Returns:
      The playable state that the game is currently in.

    • isWaitingForRoll

      default boolean isWaitingForRoll()
      Determines whether the game is currently in a state that is waiting for a roll from a player.
      Returns:
      Whether the game is currently in a state that is waiting for a roll from a player.

    • getCurrentWaitingForRollState

      @Nonnull default WaitingForRollGameState<P,S,R> getCurrentWaitingForRollState()
      Retrieves the current state of this game as an instance of WaitingForRollGameState. This will throw an error if the game is not in a state that is waiting for a roll from a player.
      Returns:
      The waiting for roll state that the game is currently in.

    • isWaitingForMove

      default boolean isWaitingForMove()
      Determines whether the game is currently in a state that is waiting for a move from a player.
      Returns:
      Whether the game is currently in a state that is waiting for a move from a player.

    • getCurrentWaitingForMoveState

      @Nonnull default WaitingForMoveGameState<P,S,R> getCurrentWaitingForMoveState()
      Retrieves the current state of this game as an instance of WaitingForMoveGameState. This will throw an error if the game is not in a state that is waiting for a move from a player.
      Returns:
      The waiting for move state that the game is currently in.

    • hasEnded

      default boolean hasEnded()
      Determines whether the game has finished.
      Returns:
      Whether the game has finished.

    • getCurrentWinState

      @Nonnull default WinGameState<P,S,R> getCurrentWinState()
      Retrieves the current state of this game as an instance of WinGameState. This will throw an error if the game has not ended.
      Returns:
      The win state that the game is currently in.

    • getBoard

      @Nonnull default Board<P> getBoard()
      Retrieves the state of the board in the current state of the game.
      Returns:

    • getWinner

      @Nonnull default S getWinner()
      Retrieves the state of the winning player.
      Returns:
      The state of the winning player.

    • getLoser

      @Nonnull default S getLoser()
      Retrieves the state of the losing player.
      Returns:
      The state of the losing player.

    • getRoll

      @Nonnull default R getRoll()
      Retrieves the roll that was made that can be used by the current turn player to make a move.
      Returns:
      The roll that was made that can now be used to make a move.

    • builder

      @Nonnull static GameBuilder builder()
      Creates a builder to assist in constructing games with custom settings.
      Returns:
      A builder to assist in constructing games with custom settings.

    • createStandard

      @Nonnull static Game<StandardPiece,PlayerState,Roll> createStandard()
      Creates a standard game that follows the default rules on RoyalUr.net. Therefore, this uses the simple rules, the standard board shape, Bell's path, the standard dice, and seven starting pieces per player.
      Returns:
      A standard game.

    • createAseb

      @Nonnull static Game<StandardPiece,PlayerState,Roll> createAseb()
      Creates a game of Aseb. This uses the simple rules, the Aseb board shape, the Aseb paths, the standard dice, and five starting pieces per player.
      Returns:
      A game of Aseb.
